text: William Grant Moggridge, RDI (25 June 1943 â€“ 8 September 2012) was a British industrial designer and co-founder of the Silicon Valley-based design firm IDEO. He helped design what was arguably the first laptop computer, the GRiD Compass. He was in favour of user-centered design process in product development cycles and also worked towards popularizing interaction design as a mainstream discipline. Moggridge was the author of Designing Interactions, published in October 2006. He was also involved in design education in the United Kingdom and the United States; teaching at the Royal College of Art, the London Business School and Stanford University. ==References== * Designing Interactions - book home page * Talk at the Innvovationsforum Interactiondesign, Germany 2007 Category:1943 births Category:2012 deaths Category:British designers
